column1: Elektrougli (Russian: Электроу́гли) is a town in Noginsky District of Moscow Oblast
column3: located on the Moscow–Nizhny Novgorod railway
column4: 36 kilometers (22 mi) east of Moscow and 18 kilometers (11 mi) southeast of Noginsk
column5: the administrative center of the district. Population: 20

column1: Urban-type settlement status was granted to it in 1935. Town status was granted in 1956.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column4: incorporated within Noginsky District as the Town of Elektrougli. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Elektrougli is incorporated within Noginsky Municipal District as Elektrougli Urban Settlement.
